moves.1... c5: The sicilian!I usually don't play 1.e4 because of it.Not because I fear the opening itself,but the studying of reams of lines that goes with it.
moves.3. d4: I usually play the Moscow variation,3.Bb5+ here.
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 g6: Dragon variation,Black aims to Fianchetto his Bishop
moves.6. Be3 Bg7 7. f3: Yugoslav attack.This leads to very exciting games due to that it usually involves opposite-side castling.
moves.7... O-O 8. Qd2 Nc6 9. Bc4: The older continuation 9.O-O-O is also good,but I stick with the main line.
moves.9... Bd7 10. O-O-O Rc8: In this variation,Black's counterplay is all based,down the c-file,White will aim for h2-h4-h5 followed by Bh6.
moves.12. Bxd4 b5 13. Nd5: ! Hitting on the idea for the d5-square
moves.13... Nxd5: The only move,according to the World database
moves.16. a3: White has the advantage,due to weakened dark-squares on the King-side,which White will take advantage of later.
moves.17... Qb6: ? Hopelessly slow.I don't really know any other move for Black though.
moves.20... Kf6 21. Qh4+: !A good move forcing Black' king back.
moves.21... Kg7: Arguably the best chance since 21...g5,21...Kf5 and 21...Ke5 all are losing.I do not wish to tire you out with all the lines I prepared.
moves.22. Qd4+: !Using the weak dark squares to his advantage
moves.22... f6 23. Qh4: !The queen heads BACK to h4 after forcing Black,to play f6 further weakening the position.Black was played all the way to mate through intertia,I suppose.
This game was quite a bloody one and helped me win my group with a 5/6 score(I lost one due to time-out)Comments are quite welcome.

gameName: If you Fianchetto your Bishop,be careful of trading it off when heavy pieces are still on the board!
